metadata.title: CVE-2019-11697 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
If the ALT and "a" keys are pressed when users receive an extensioninstallation prompt, the extension will be installed without the installprompt delay that keeps the prompt visible in order for users to accept ordecline the installation. A malicious web page could use this with spoofingon the page to trick users into installing a malicious extension. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 67.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11697` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
